page.title: 03Mark's Crafts and Industries
page.content: Wensley's made cartwheels which each took a week.They used fresh spring water from a 14ft well to cool the wheels after making the rims white hot to attach them to the wooden wheels. The White Horse{Inn}at the corner of Vole Road is a popular eating place at the present time. Locksbroad{Farm}at the junction with Yarrow Road is the home of the famous Tucker's{Cheese Packers.}They supply many shops in the Bristol,Burnham and Weston areas. Halfway along the Causeway is the {Timber Yard}of F.W.Morgan. Here the timber is brought in in long lengths,cut to required length for the trade and redistributed. Near the Crossroads is Japonica Farm where{cider}is made and sold. At the West end of the village is a local{bakery}still delivering bread.
